content.raw:
mm how does the Render system work with the Scene3D plugin? 

In Scene3D, there’s [logic for managing the opengl context](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/src/df7598268ad4f3d7c27bf45dc4cf3617c193da1b/src/plugins/Scene3D.cc#lines-215). The render window context needs to be activated before any ign-rendering calls and deactivated afterwards so it does not interfere with Qt. We also need to make sure all the ign-rendering calls happen in the same thread. 

It’s kind of inconvenient but it seems like it’s the way to go for getting ogre to work with QtQuick

mm how does the Render system work with the Scene3D plugin?

In Scene3D, there’s logic for managing the opengl context. The render window context needs to be activated before any ign-rendering calls and deactivated afterwards so it does not interfere with Qt. We also need to make sure all the ign-rendering calls happen in the same thread.

It’s kind of inconvenient but it seems like it’s the way to go for getting ogre to work with QtQuick
